intro: Dubautia laxa var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy Dubautia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, glandular leaves and stems, which give it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in full sun and well-drained soil. Dubautia laxa var. hirsuta is often found in mesic to xeric habitats, showcasing its adaptability to the unique ecosystems of Hawaii.
